proposals.reasoning: This aligns with the emerging consensus for a low-drama, baseline first mission. Bob and Charlie are both active voices we can start to read early, while Grace provides a quieter slot that multiple people have already flagged as acceptable. Keeping Alice and me off the same initial team avoids consolidating too much influence, and this composition gives us a relatively low-suspicion test that many players have already signaled comfort with, which should give us a clean early signal and a clear trail of who supported it if something goes wrong.

votes.comment: Strong table consensus on this as a low-drama baseline; opposing it now without a clear alternative would look more suspicious than useful.
I’m on the team, it has broad consensus as a low-info baseline, and there are no strong red flags yet—getting an early result here is useful for reads.
No known evil on it from my perspective and it fits the low‑info baseline everyone wanted for Mission 1.
Solid consensus baseline; keeps loud voices split and gives a clean early info read without looking overly engineered.

I’d rather not lock in a ‘quiet baseline’ where none of the more-talked-about players (including me) are present; I want at least one of Alice/Bob/Eve on the team so we get a clearer early read instead of potentially giving three low-info players a free pass.
As evil I want at least one teammate on the first mission to enable a possible sabotage and gather info, so a fully unknown/likely-good trio isn’t ideal.
I’m on the team and there’s broad consensus this is a low‑drama baseline; mission 1 is worth using for info unless there’s a strong concrete objection, which we don’t have yet.
Solid low‑info baseline with broad support; we need an early data point and there’s no strong reason yet to suspect heavy evil stacking on this team.
Decent low-info baseline and includes Charlie, who’s in the Merlin/Morgana pair I want early reads on; fine to use this for initial signal.

discussion.content: I’d be pretty comfortable with a team like me, Bob, and Eve to start, and I’m a bit wary of throwing Henry on an early mission with so little info.

I’m okay being on the first team, but I’d prefer something like me, Alice, and Charlie instead of Eve until we’ve seen a bit more table talk. Early missions should be as “low suspicion” as possible so we get a clean signal.

I’d rather not lock in Alice on the very first team just because she spoke up first—something like Bob, me, and Grace (or Eve) feels like a safer baseline to test. Early on I’d prefer we avoid putting too much power in the hands of the loudest voices until we see more reactions.

I’d like at least one of Alice/Bob on the first mission so we get an early read on the main drivers, but I don’t love locking both in yet—something like Bob, Charlie, and Grace feels like a decent low‑info test without handing too much control to any one cluster.

I’m pretty happy with something like Bob, Charlie, and me as a starting team—it spreads influence around without locking in both Alice and Bob together right away. That gives us an early read on two active voices plus one quieter slot.

I like the idea of a Bob/Charlie/Grace team as a first pass—keeps the early mission relatively “quiet” while we get more talking and don’t over‑commit to the loudest voices yet. I’d rather avoid putting both Alice and Eve on right away until we’ve seen how everyone reacts to a cleaner baseline.

I’m generally on board with the Bob/Charlie/Grace suggestion for a low‑drama first mission, but I’d like to hear a bit more from Henry and Iris before we completely lock in a “quiet” block as our baseline.

I like the Bob/Charlie/Grace baseline as a starting point, but I’d prefer we don’t treat it as “locked” just because it’s quiet—if that team passes and still gets sabotaged, I’m looking hard at whoever pushed it as “safe” the loudest.

I’m okay with the Bob/Charlie/Grace team as a starting point, but I’d like whoever proposes it to be very clear on their reasoning so that if it does get sabotaged we have a clean trail of who vouched hardest for it.

proposals.reasoning: I’m following the broadly agreed plan of keeping two members from the clean first mission while adding two new players. Bob and Grace come from the successful Mission 1 team, giving us a semi-tested core without over-clearing all three of Bob/Charlie/Grace. Alice has been actively engaged in the discussion and was a popular suggestion to add, and Henry fits the “fresh but thoughtful” role several people mentioned. This lineup matches the general consensus of two from the original trio plus two newer faces, and it’s consistent with the kind of team composition I previously said I’d support.

votes.comment: I like the structure of two from the clean first mission plus two new players, and I want to see how this mixed group behaves before we start narrowing suspects too hard.

Team follows the broadly agreed structure (two from the clean first mission plus two new), keeps a semi-tested core with me and Grace, and there’s no strong reason yet to suspect any of Alice or Henry enough to stall progress.
I like keeping Bob and Grace, but I’m not comfortable adding both untested Alice and Henry when we could swap one of them for someone like Charlie or Diana to spread risk a bit more.

Fits the broadly agreed structure of 2 from the first clean mission plus 2 new players; no strong reason yet to distrust any of Bob, Grace, Alice, or Henry, and we need info from new players on missions.
Team likely has at least one evil (Alice), so I want it to go and give evil a chance to sabotage.
Fits my stated preference of two from the first team plus Alice and Henry, and it includes at least one evil without looking suspicious.
Keeps a solid core from the clean first mission (me and Bob) while adding two new players for info; no strong reason yet to distrust any of them.
Team matches the agreed structure (two from the clean mission plus two new), is close to the lineup I already supported, and gives good info while we’re ahead 1–0.
Fits the 2-from-M1-plus-2-new plan and includes Alice, who I want tested and potentially protected; no strong red flags yet.

discussion.content: Bob, Charlie, and Grace all look pretty good after that clean first mission, so I’d start by prioritizing them. I also don’t mind having Eve involved again since she chose a safe team, and I’m more wary of people who haven’t been tested yet.

I like keeping a strong core from the first mission, but a clean result doesn’t prove all three of us are good—so I’d start with two of Bob/Charlie/Grace and add one new person, probably Alice or Diana, rather than auto-clearing Eve just for picking a safe team once.

I’m on board with keeping a core of two from Bob/Charlie/Grace, but I’d rather add someone like Diana or Henry than rush to include Alice just because she’s been vocal. That gives us a mix of proven-ish and fresh without overcommitting to any one read this early.

I like the idea of keeping two from Bob/Charlie/Grace, but I’d rather not treat that first mission as full clearance—something like Bob + Grace plus one of Alice/Henry and one of me feels like a good balance of tested and new.

I’d stick with two from Bob/Charlie/Grace, but I actually like adding Alice and Diana together so we’re not overfocusing on the exact same trio every time. That gives us a solid core plus two people who’ve both been thinking things through out loud.

I don’t think we should treat the first mission as clearing all three, so I’d go with two of Bob/Charlie/Grace plus Alice and someone who hasn’t had much attention yet, like Henry. That keeps a “proven” core without tunneling too hard on the exact same trio.

I like the idea of keeping two from the first team, and obviously I trust myself, but I’d rather not auto-include all of Bob/Charlie/Eve just off one clean mission—something like me + one of Bob/Charlie plus two newer faces (Diana/Henry/Alice) feels safer for now.

I’m on board with the “two from Bob/Charlie/Grace plus two new” approach, and I’d lean toward something like Grace + Bob + me + Diana so we’re mixing a semi-tested core with a couple of fresh, but reasonably engaged, picks without auto-clearing Eve or Alice yet.

I like the general “two from Bob/Charlie/Grace plus two new” idea, but I’d especially lean toward something like Charlie + Grace with Alice and either Henry or Diana so we’re mixing a semi-tested core with people who’ve been actively thinking things through. That feels like a good balance of info-gain without over-clearing anyone off one clean mission.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2 failed with the core Bob/Grace/Henry plus Alice, so the safest move is to minimize overlap with that group while still using our best info from the successful Mission 1. Mission 1’s team of Bob/Charlie/Grace was clean, so Bob and Charlie both have some positive equity from that result, whereas I (Grace) and Henry are the most directly tied to the fail on Mission 2 and should sit out to narrow down the source of that sabotage. Adding Diana and Iris brings in two players who have not been on a failed mission yet and are broadly trusted in discussion, while keeping both me and Henry off the team and avoiding the Alice/Henry/Grace entanglement. This lineup maximizes the use of known-clean structure from Mission 1, introduces fresh players, and gives us strong info regardless of the outcome.

votes.comment: I still don’t like having Bob from the failed Mission 2 core on here; I’d rather see a lineup that fully avoids that suspect group so we get clearer info from this mission.

Uses the clean Mission 1 core (me and Charlie), excludes the main suspects from the failed Mission 2 (Grace, Henry, and likely Alice), and adds two relatively untainted players (Diana, Iris), making this one of the safest and most informative options.
No overlap with the most suspicious Mission 2 core, builds off the clean Mission 1 info, and includes two players who haven’t been on a failed team yet.
Minimizes overlap with failed Mission 2 (only Bob), uses info from clean Mission 1 with Bob/Charlie, and includes me and Iris who haven’t been on a failed team yet; acceptable risk for crucial info.

I still don’t love having Bob on yet another key mission right after being in the failed lineup—I'd rather see a team that changes that slot, ideally including me instead, to better isolate where the sabotage came from.
All-untested lineup for this mission gives evil no chance to sabotage and moves good to 2 successes; better to push for a team including at least one suspected player from the Mission 2 core.

I know I’m good, so the Mission 2 spy is in {Bob, Alice, Henry}. This team still includes Bob when we could field a team like Charlie/Diana/Iris/Eve that avoids all three suspects entirely, so this isn’t the safest configuration.

Best balance of using Mission 1’s partial trust (Bob/Charlie) while minimizing overlap with the failed Mission 2; only Bob returns from the failed team, and with me knowing I’m good, the most likely culprit pool for that sabotage is Grace/Alice, making this lineup reasonably safe and informative.

Builds off clean Mission 1 (Bob/Charlie), avoids most of the Mission 2 fail core (Grace, Henry, Alice), and includes two fresh players (Diana, me) for good info. Reasonable risk profile for Mission 3.

discussion.content: Given Mission 2’s fail, we know at least one of Bob/Grace/Henry is bad, so for this team I’d really like to avoid repeating that exact core and instead mix in people who haven’t been on a failed mission yet. I’m more inclined to trust Charlie and Diana right now than anyone tied to that last team.

I get wanting to avoid the Mission 2 core, but remember Mission 1 with me/Charlie/Grace was clean—right now I’m most suspicious of Grace (on both teams) plus Alice/Henry, so I’d prefer a team built around me, Charlie, and maybe adding Diana/Iris rather than reusing too many from that failed lineup.

I like the idea of building off the clean Mission 1 core but adjusting for the fail—something like me, Bob, plus a couple of fresh faces like Diana and Iris (or Eve) avoids over‑reusing that last team while still leaning on what’s worked. Keeping too many overlaps from Mission 2, especially Alice and Grace together, just feels unnecessarily risky right now.

I’m most wary of Grace right now since she was on both teams, so I’d rather see a lineup like Charlie, me, Iris, and maybe one of Eve/Bob than repeat too much of that Mission 2 core. Let’s keep the overlaps with the failed team to a minimum so we actually learn something from this mission.

I’m pretty comfortable leaning on the Mission 1 info, so I’d like to see something like Bob, Charlie, me, and either Diana or Iris, and keep Grace/Henry off this one since they’re the shadiest from that last fail.

Given the Mission 2 fail, I really don’t want to see a team that includes both Grace and Henry together again—if we build off the Mission 1 info, I’d be more comfortable with something like Bob, Charlie, Diana, and Iris, keeping that suspicious overlap off this round.

I get why people are side‑eyeing me after being on both teams, but Mission 1 with me/Bob/Charlie was clean, so to minimize risk this round I’d go with something like Bob, Charlie, Diana, and Iris while keeping both me and Henry off to narrow down where that Mission 2 fail came from.
I’m fine sitting this one out—given the Mission 2 fail, I’d rather see a team like Charlie, Diana, Iris, plus one of Eve/Frank so we completely avoid the whole Bob/Grace/Alice tangle this round.

I’d rather steer clear of the Mission 2 core for now—especially Grace, Henry, and probably Bob—and go with something like Charlie, Diana, me, plus one of Eve or Alice. That leans on the clean Mission 1 info without over‑reusing the failed lineup.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2 is the only failed mission, and its team was [Bob, Grace, Alice, Henry] with exactly one fail card. Missions 1 and 3 both succeeded with zero fails, and the common safe core emerging from the table talk and results is Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris, who just passed Mission 3 together clean. To minimize the chance of including the Mission 2 spy again, it’s best to avoid the main suspicion cluster {Grace, Alice, Henry}. Among the players who have not been on the failed Mission 2, Eve is widely trusted and has strong support from most players as the safest fifth member over Frank. Therefore, the most consistent and broadly accepted low-risk team is [Bob, Charlie, Diana, Iris, Eve].

votes.comment: Only one suspected evil (Eve) on a 5-player mission that likely needs 2 fails to sabotage; this team is too safe for Good and we need a riskier lineup with more overlap from Mission 2.

As good Bob, I know I’m not the Mission 2 spy, so the spy there is in {Grace, Alice, Henry}. This team avoids all three of them while keeping the previously clean core Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris, making it the lowest-risk option available.

Keeps both main suspected clusters from Mission 2 (including Alice and Henry/Grace) off the team while relying on a previously clean core; at worst it likely has only one spy, giving good odds this late.
Sticks with the proven-clean core from Mission 3 (Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris) and adds Eve, who wasn’t on the failed Mission 2, avoiding the main suspicion cluster {Grace, Alice, Henry}.
I want the widely trusted core plus me to go; if this somehow fails it gives us critical information before the final mission.
Team matches table consensus and keeps suspicion off me while still including an evil player.

Best low-risk option: it avoids both Alice and Henry from the failed Mission 2, and from my perspective the spy there must be in {Bob, Alice, Henry}, so this team has at most Bob from that cluster plus four broadly trusted players.

Best available option: reuse the clean Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris core and avoid the main Mission 2 suspicion cluster {Grace, Alice, Henry}. Eve as the fifth hasn’t been on a failed mission and is broadly trusted, so this lineup maximizes the odds of a success.
Sticks with the fully clean core from Mission 3 and adds someone outside the Mission 2 fail cluster, which is the lowest-risk option available.

discussion.content: Given Mission 2’s single fail and the two clean runs with Bob/Charlie/Diana, I’m most suspicious of Henry and Grace right now, so I’d like to see a team built around Bob, Charlie, Diana, Iris, and one of the quieter players (including me if you’re comfortable with that).

I’m really happy with Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris as a core, since that exact combo just passed clean, and the only possible spy from the failed mission has to be in {Grace, Alice, Henry}, so I’d rather take our fifth from Frank or Eve instead of dipping back into that pool.

I like sticking with the clean team of Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris as the core, and for the fifth I’d rather add Eve than anyone from the failed mission 2 lineup. That keeps us away from the most suspicious cluster without overcomplicating things.

Given that I know I’m good and that Bob/Charlie/Iris all just passed a mission with me, I’m very comfortable locking in that core four and taking the fifth from outside the Mission 2 pool—Eve slightly over Frank, but I’d accept either.

I’m on board with sticking to the Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris core since they’ve been clean together, and I’d rather add someone who hasn’t touched the failed Mission 2—so between me and Frank, I obviously think I’m the safer fifth.

Given Mission 2 is our only fail and I was on that team, I’m totally fine being left off here—sticking with the clean Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris core and adding Eve, who hasn’t touched the failed mission, feels like the safest combo right now.

Given that I know I’m good, the single fail on Mission 2 has to be coming from {Bob, Alice, Henry}, and since Bob just passed clean with Charlie/Diana/Iris, I’m fine trusting that core and adding Eve as the fifth while keeping Alice and Henry off.
Given Mission 2 is the only fail and I know I’m good, I’m inclined to think the spy is in {Grace, Alice}, so I’m happy with the Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris core plus Eve and I’m fine staying off this one.
Sticking with the clean Bob/Charlie/Diana/Iris core makes sense to me, and since our only fail points back toward the Mission 2 pool, I’m most comfortable adding Eve as the fifth here.

proposals.reasoning: I’m locking in the Mission 3 core of Charlie–Diana–Iris, which produced a clean success with 0 fails. Bob has been on both failed missions (2 and 4), making him the most likely common cause of those fails, so I’m keeping him off. Henry has also been on both failed missions, which makes him too risky for this last team. Eve only appears on the failed Mission 4 alongside Bob, so her alignment is ambiguous but still tied directly to a fail, and I’d rather avoid that overlap as well. From the remaining pool, Grace has been on one success (Mission 1) and one fail (Mission 2) together with Bob, so if Bob is the main suspect for the repeated fails, Grace is more likely to be good than he is. Frank has not been on any mission teams, so he isn’t directly tied to either of the failed results and represents the least entangled option. This team preserves the proven-successful M3 core, excludes the players most correlated with the failures (Bob, Henry, and tentatively Eve), and fills out the last two slots with the lowest-risk options based on the mission history.

votes.comment: This keeps Bob and Eve off while locking in the clean Mission 3 core of Charlie/Diana/Iris and adds relatively low-information players in Grace and Frank, which fits the logic I argued for earlier.

Charlie, Diana, and Iris are confirmed good from Mission 3, and I know I’m good as well, so the safest team is Charlie–Diana–Iris–Bob plus just one uncertain slot. This proposed team adds two unknowns (Grace and Frank) while unnecessarily leaving off a confirmed-good player (me), increasing the risk of including a spy.
Including a completely untested player like Frank on the final mission feels too risky—better to stick with the Charlie/Diana/Iris core and add from people with clearer track records.

Core of Charlie–Diana–Iris is good, but Frank pushed a Bob+Frank team earlier when Bob is the prime common factor on both fails, which makes Frank too risky for the final mission. I’d rather see CDI plus two from Alice/Grace/Henry, avoiding both Bob and Eve and also leaving out Frank.
Frank is evil with me, so having him as the sole saboteur on a 5-person final mission is ideal for securing a fail.
I’m evil and on the team; with only one evil present I can safely sabotage to win if this is approved.

CDI+Grace is fine, but Frank is completely untested and the leader’s reasoning incorrectly claims Henry was on both failed missions, which is suspicious. I’d rather see CDI+Grace plus Henry/Alice instead.
Keeps the trusted M3 core (Charlie/Diana/Iris) and excludes the main failure suspects Bob and Eve; only Grace/Frank are uncertain, but this is likely the safest available team.
I want the Charlie–Diana–Iris core, but I’d rather add from Alice/Grace/Henry than bring in the completely untested Frank when we’re this close to the end.

proposals.reasoning: The table has broadly converged on Charlie–Diana–Iris as the safest core after Mission 3’s clean success with exactly that trio. Both failed missions (2 and 4) contained Bob, and Mission 4 only flipped from the Mission 3 success pattern once Eve was added, so keeping both Bob and Eve off this final team best aligns with most players’ stated preferences. For the last two slots, Grace has strong support as an add-on to the CDI core and was only tied to a single failed mission in a mixed, noisy lineup, while I recognize I was also on Mission 2 but, compared to more heavily implicated options like Bob/Eve and the debated inclusion of Frank, several players (Diana, Grace, Henry, Iris, Eve) explicitly suggested or were comfortable with adding me. This team follows the consensus CDI core, avoids the most suspicious repeat patterns (Bob/Eve), and fills out with widely acceptable picks (Grace plus myself) to maximize approval while minimizing perceived risk.

votes.comment: I’m the only one on this team who can sabotage, so I want this lineup to go through.
Mission 2’s single fail means exactly one of {Alice, Grace, Henry} is evil (Bob is good). This team includes both Alice and Grace, so it is guaranteed to contain at least one spy.

I like the Charlie–Diana–Iris core, but this lineup still includes Alice, who was on the M2 fail and is one of the more contested picks. I’d rather see a version with CDI plus two from Grace/Henry/Bob that avoids both Alice and Eve.

This team puts both Alice and Grace from the M2 fail on the mission while leaving the untainted Frank off; I’d rather keep the CDI core but swap in Frank over one of the M2-linked players to reduce the chance of including an evil.

It follows the widely agreed Charlie–Diana–Iris core while keeping the most suspicious repeat patterns (Bob and Eve) off the team, and Alice/Grace were both frequently suggested as reasonable additions.
Team includes at least one known evil (Alice); rejecting risks a fully good team being approved next.

Keeps the most suspicious pair Bob/Eve off, preserves the trusted Charlie–Diana–Iris core, and adds me plus Alice—where between Alice/Henry I have to accept one possible M2 spy anyway. This is close to the safest realistically passable team.

Bob is very likely evil from being on both fails, and Frank’s consistent defense of Bob makes Frank suspicious too; that points to a spy likely being among Alice/Frank rather than Henry. Replacing Alice with Henry (keeping the CDI+Grace core) looks strictly safer than this lineup, so I don’t want to lock this team in.
As Percival I’m reading Alice as more likely Merlin than Charlie, and if evils are Bob/Eve/Frank then this team (Alice, Charlie, Diana, Grace, Iris) is fully good and keeps the main suspects off.

discussion.content: Given that both failed missions had Bob on them, I really don’t want him anywhere near this last team—I'd feel best with a core of Charlie, Diana, and Iris, plus two others who haven’t been tied to multiple fails.

Mission 3 proves Charlie, Diana, and Iris are all clean, and since adding Eve on Mission 4 is what flipped it to a fail, Eve is almost certainly evil—so we should lock in Charlie/Diana/Iris, keep Eve off, and I’m happy to go too with someone like Frank rather than risking Grace/Alice/Henry.

Sticking with the Mission 3 core of me, Diana, and Iris feels safest, and I’d rather fill the last two slots from Grace/Henry/Bob than from people tied to both failed teams like Alice/Frank or the M4 swing addition, Eve.

Given M3’s clean result with Charlie/Iris/me and M4 only flipping once Eve was added, I really want a core of Charlie–Diana–Iris with Eve and Bob both off the team. I’d round it out with someone relatively untested like Frank plus one of Alice/Grace/Henry rather than reusing the people most tied to the fails.

I’m fine staying off this one, but I really don’t like how much we’re auto-clearing Bob when he’s been on both fails—if we’re building around Charlie/Diana/Iris, I’d rather see someone like Alice or Grace added than just defaulting to Bob again.

If we’re locking in Charlie/Diana/Iris, I think the cleanest read is that the extra pieces on the two fails were Alice and Eve, so I’d round it out with Bob and myself while keeping Alice/Eve (and probably Henry) off this last team.
I really want us to lock in Charlie/Diana/Iris, and I’d add myself plus one of Alice or Henry—Bob being on both fails and Eve flipping M4 makes them both too risky for this last team.
Given what we’ve seen, I’m most comfortable locking in Charlie/Diana/Iris and keeping both Bob and Eve off this team; from there I’d like to add myself plus either Grace or Alice to round it out.

I’m fully on board with the Charlie–Diana–Iris core, and I really don’t want either Bob or Eve on this last team given the fail patterns. I’d like to see us add two from Alice/Grace/Henry rather than recycling the people most tied to the failed missions.
